intro: Atractylodes lancea, commonly known as Chinese Atractylodes, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hollow, ridged stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its rhizomes are the primary part used in traditional medicine, valued for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Atractylodes lancea is often cultivated for its medicinal value and is also used in herbal remedies for digestive and respiratory ailments.
